commands.name: manage-aliases
commands.title: Manage Aliases
commands.description: View, add, edit, and remove zsh aliases

tools.name: add-alias
tools.title: Add Alias

name.description: The name of the alias to create

command.description: The command that the alias should execute

configFile.description: The configuration file to add the alias to (.zshrc, .zsh_aliases, or .aliases). If not specified, defaults to the first available config file

tools.name: remove-alias
tools.title: Remove Alias

name.description: The name of the alias to remove

configFile.description: The configuration file containing the alias (.zshrc, .zsh_aliases, or .aliases). If not specified, searches all config files

tools.name: update-alias
tools.title: Update Alias

currentName.description: The current name of the alias to update

newName.description: The new name for the alias (can be the same as currentName)

newCommand.description: The new command for the alias

configFile.description: The configuration file containing the alias (.zshrc, .zsh_aliases, or .aliases). If not specified, searches all config files

evals.input: @zsh-aliases Add new alias "dev" that runs npm run dev

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
